result.execSummary:
The defendant Michelle Y. Decorah was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court costs payable as follows:  $25.00 due on or before 05/05/2022 and then $25.00 is due the 5th of each month thereafter until paid in full.  $15.00 payment plan fee added.  Failure to pay any part of the court costs will result in 1 day in jail for every $25 left unpaid.

The defendant is ORDERED  to report to the Jackson County Jail to submit the required DNA specimen and report for booking. Contact the Jackson County Sheriff's Department at 715-284-5357 to arrange for an appointment.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michelle Y. Decorah

defendant.name: Decorah, Michelle Y.
defendant.address: 303 Stacy Drive P.O. Box 823, Black River Fall, WI 54615

records.addlTxt:
10:44 AM Defendant Michelle Y. Decorah in court.  Attorney Crystal Leigh Jensen in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Bryant S Plank in court for Michelle Y. Decorah. Defendant enters a plea of No Contest to Count 1. State is in victim rights compliance. 

Court reviewed the elements and potential penalties of the charge the defendant plead to. She understood.  Court reviewed the plea questionnaire, constitutional rights and elements with the defendant. She understood. Defense stipulated that there is a factual basis for the plea.  Court found that the defendant freely, voluntarily, knowingly and intelligently entered her plea and waived her constitutional rights.  Court found that a factual basis exists for the plea.  Found guilty of Disorderly Conduct contrary to 947.01(1), 968.075(1)(a). Count 2 dismissed and read in for sentencing purposes. Defendant did not exercise her right to allocution. 

Joint recommendation: Pay court costs only

Court adopt joint recommendation: Orders court costs only. $543.00. Pay @ $25.00 month starting 5/5/2022, paying by the fifth of the month thereafter until paid in full. 

The defendant is ORDERED  to report to the Jackson County Jail to submit the required DNA specimen and report for booking. Contact the Jackson County Sheriff's Department at 715-284-5357 to arrange for an appointment.
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 18, 2022 at 10:30 am.

3:12 PM Attorney Bryant S Plank for Michelle Y. Decorah appeared in court, Attorney Emily Hynek for State of Wisconsin appeared in court.  Ready for plea/sent. Plea/Sent Hearing set for 4/18 at 10:30am.

Status conference on March 21, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
